Question
========

Researchers want to know if there is a difference in information processing between synesthesiologists and ordinary people. To this end, they randomly draw 33 individuals from the population of synesthesiologists and 27 from the population of ordinary people. It is known that the distribution of their dependent variable is not symmetric. It is prudent in this case if the researchers perform the following test:

Answerlist
----------

* McNemar's test.
* Wilcoxon's test.
* Paired t-test.

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* McNemar's test..: Incorrect
* Wilcoxon's test: Correct
* Paired t-test..: Incorrect
